Yes Tam Tam! You have to also guard your heart and not focus on the negative comments. Amanda, you can't control people who are hurting or just plain awful which shows in their comments but you can control yourself so stop reading the comments if they bother you that much. The truth is that all other talk shows experience the same and sometimes worse experience with commenters. For example, I just happened to check out Wendy Williams comments and I must say there were more bad than good yet she keeps going. This is The Real and I must keep it real, you'll have got to develop thicker skins, guard your hearts and eyes and keep it pushing. Consider, the fans that love you and do it for them and yourselves. Y'all receive more good comments than bad so focus on that and spend less time going back and forth with people y'all don't even know. FYI, you would be shocked to know that some negative comments are from men but they use different picturesğŸ˜²ğŸ˜². I know that for a fact. Just saying. Of course, women and minorities are very competitive and hypercritical of one another. It frustrates me that we don't see where this energy comes from. Society used to be solely led by white men. This was legal, intentional, and written into the fabric of society. In the past, only select, very talented people could rise to the pinnacle of success. It was not an open platform. It was established that one woman met a quota and two were too much representation. We were not given the opportunity to lift one another without jeopardizing ourselves. So YES, support other women and minorities BUT also hold them accountable. OUR society cannot handle criticism and its damaging progress and evolution. Empowering women does not mean we should empower vapid behavior and decisions because that is not "support", it is enabling.
